inventory.commentary: 15Mar07 - updated to wn2.1, added features. ahouston 15Mar07 split Sense 1 into Sense 1 and Sense 7, ahouston. 15Mar07 split Sense 2 into Sense 2 and Sense 8, ahouston. 15Mar07 merged Senses 3 and 6, ahouston

sense.name: a significant link or association between things
sense.commentary: CONNECTION[+relation][+association][+significant] Any relationship or non-physical link between two things. Can refer to electronic signals.
sense.examples: The connection between church and state is inescapable. There was a connection between eating that pickle and having that bad dream. What's your connection to John? Only a brilliant detective could find connections among the evidence.

sense.name: Influential person
sense.examples: I used my connections in Washington to get my son a job. You need connections to break into Hollywood.

sense.name: Object that connects
sense.commentary: CONNECTION[+entity][+artifact][+device][+linking] A physical object, often involved in electronic equipment, that is used to connect things.
sense.examples: Your speaker isn't working because you've got a dirty connection. Try re-checking the connections before you call tech support. I snapped a connection and couldn't finish the model airplane. The two wood blocks form an L-connection.

sense.name: Act of connecting
sense.commentary: CONNECTION[+event][+joining] The act of bringing two or more things together, either physically or non-physically.
sense.examples: Classical conditioning is the process of learning by connection. The connection of the two railroad lines would make transportation much easier. John's first connection to the Internet occurred yesterday at noon. I recall the connection of your fist and my chin as a painful event.

sense.name: Travel switch
sense.commentary: CONNECTION[+event][+transfer][+transportation][+mode] The act of switching from one form of transportation to another. Most often used when switching air planes.
sense.examples: His plane was late and he missed his connection in Atlanta. I have a very tight connection in Dallas.

sense.name: narcotics supplier
sense.examples: The addict had several shadowy drug connections.

sense.name: the state of being in contact
sense.examples: I hope to make some personal connections at the meeting. The computer has a mega-fast connection to the Internet. The wire has to be attached to complete the connection and let current flow. There was some static on the phone, and then we lost the connection. I sense that you and I have a strong personal connection.
